item.title: 175 – swimming in the dark
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: swimming in the dark siren song: we quit drinking to save the baby we quit quit drinking to make the baby made instead no baby but its parts salt water arms heart slender fingers curled sound of no-teeth mouth crying … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
swimming in the dark

siren song: we quit drinking
to save the baby we quit
quit drinking to make the baby
made instead no baby but
its parts salt water arms
heart slender fingers
curled sound of
no-teeth mouth crying come
come all we want
calm the fight
of salt sea
fists & heave
never ending
thin shadows lain
over waves
penumbra
shanty-sung shape
unthought
swimming
in the dark

item.title: 174 – Alive
item.dc:creator: Graham

item.title: 173 – A figher pilot tells of phosphorescence
item.dc:creator: Graham

item.title: 172 – Sisyphus
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Sisyphus I roll a stone uphill all night forever tumbling inside you sound of seashells self-flagellating in the dryer arms ache from keeping this position bent-arm Atlas one cold ear turned always to the stone & its quiet voice when … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Sisyphus

I roll a stone uphill
all night forever
tumbling inside you

sound of seashells
self-flagellating
in the dryer

arms ache from keeping
this position
bent-arm Atlas

one cold ear turned
always to the stone
& its quiet voice

when my foot slips
casting down
the stone rolls

& breaks
& breaks
into shards

I walk the mound down
find another stone
to bring again

tumbling
in my aching arms
all night long

item.title: 171 – You
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: You are not a knot (not) knot a knot, blood a blood knot, knotted not unknot the knot you are not (yet)
item.content:encoded:
You

are not
a knot (not)
knot a knot, blood
a blood knot, knotted
not unknot the knot
you are not
(yet)

item.title: 170 – Laurel Hedge
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Laurel Hedge They ruined the mystery in an afternoon. $300 lopped off the Hand of Fate. $300 and two dudes with a hedge trimmer and a pickup. The wind makes no waves. So it’s a squirrel who runs limb to … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Laurel Hedge

They ruined the mystery
in an afternoon. $300
lopped off the Hand of Fate.
$300 and two dudes
with a hedge trimmer
and a pickup.

The wind makes no waves.

So it’s a squirrel who runs
limb to limb. I learn
blue jay’s flutter-hop
from my back deck.
Our tabby slinks off
hidden in plain sight.

What gods we’ve exorcised.

The neighbors grow bodies
to hold their voices, alive
through the naked branches.
Wreathed in grill smoke
full of light
they beckon to us.

What will come if we pass to them?
What awaits us there?

item.title: 169 – Berm
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Berm I swallow shrapnel with a cup of cold water shred my insides with probiotics and fiber. I’m building a berm inside myself. My calve veins pulse an unnamed country. When the black star meaning capitol blooms I’ll surrender. They’ll … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Berm

I swallow shrapnel
with a cup of cold water

shred my insides
with probiotics and fiber.

I’m building a berm
inside myself.

My calve veins pulse
an unnamed country.

When the black star
meaning capitol blooms

I’ll surrender.
They’ll play Taps

while the lights turn out
and the revolution

turns back to guts
and ashes.

Skin sloughs. Bone
wears away.

Fibrous twists of wire
will plant themselves

in the crater that was
me. New growth

will sprout
covering what’s left.

item.title: 168 – Indivisible
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Indivisible 1 + 1 = 2 unless one is a wad of gum chummed under a desk: Bazooka Joe meets Tutti Frutti. Voilà: Chiclets. Your lungs are lobes like ears form of a cuttlefish to keep you breathing here. In … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Indivisible

1 + 1 = 2 unless
one is a wad

of gum chummed
under a desk:

Bazooka Joe meets Tutti Frutti.
Voilà: Chiclets.

Your lungs are lobes
like ears

form of a
cuttlefish

to keep you breathing
here. In the fun house

the crazy mirrors make
& remake your body

down a long hallway
bent into ∞ .

We are all human
donuts. A kind of zero

sum–dividing & dividing
into nothing

but ourselves.
(h/t: Ben Mirov’s poem Mistakes)

item.title: 167 – Genetics
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Genetics We evolved under the jack pine our mammoth dark selves spread out against the greater dark lit through fire and tales told with inward stares while behind the million eyes watch glinting green the shamanic dance the cones make … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Genetics

We evolved under the jack pine
our mammoth dark selves spread

out against the greater dark
lit through fire and tales

told with inward stares
while behind the million eyes

watch glinting green
the shamanic dance

the cones make spilling
their seeds out

on the ground charred
into life

we smear the scent of pine
oil in our beards

trailing smoke
and ashes

carrying the fire
deeper in

item.title: 166 – Milky Way
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Milky Way a ticker tape parade through the city center in a shiny convertible waving & cheering & carrying on but for the confetti hanging unmoving a field of paper stars that refuses to fall I can nearly touch & … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Milky Way

a ticker tape parade
through the city center
in a shiny convertible
waving & cheering
& carrying on but
for the confetti

hanging unmoving
a field of paper stars
that refuses to fall
I can nearly touch
& brush
sharp edges denying
gravity

the crown I expect
to wear, pick from my hair
doesn’t settle doesn’t come
suspended in a pale belt
just out of reach

the brass band sounds
far away & underwater
celebrating something other
spectators vanished
without concessions
no stray dogs to wander

with me
the empty heart
of the city evacuated
but for cut-up stars
glowing overhead
